roleset.name: caused by/indicating disease/pathology

example.name: pathologic-j
example.text: The impression prevails in certain quarters that the presence of lactic acid is pathologic of cancer .

roleset.note: PATHOLOGIC-J NOTES: Added by Julia based on medi-tmprl1to8. (from pathologic.01-j)

roleset.name: categorize something as a pathology

example.name: pathologize-v
example.text: As was observed after other disasters involving destruction and loss of life and their media depictions , such as those of the 2001 World Trade Center Attacks or Hurricane Katrina - and has been recently observed in the 2010 Haiti earthquake , it is also important not to pathologize the reactions to loss and displacement or disruption of governmental administration and services , but rather to validate these reactions , to support constructive problem - solving and reflection as to how one might improve the conditions of those affected . [ 73 ]

propbank.arg: the reactions to loss and displacement or disruption of governmental administration and services

example.name: pathologize-v
example.text: authority to produce knowledge about gender variance should not lie with clinicians who had pathologized it as a mental illness

roleset.note: PATHOLOGIZE-V, PATHOLOGIZATION-N NOTES: Added by Julia for clearearth-earthquakes.

example.name: pathology-n
example.text: Pathology demonstrated a tubular adenoma with moderate dysplasia .
example.amr: (d / demonstrate-01 :ARG0 (p / pathology-03) :ARG1 (d4 / disease-disorder :name (n / name :op1 "adenoma") :ARG1-of (t / tubular-02) :accompanier (d3 / disease-disorder :name (n4 / name :op1 "dysplasia") :ARG1-of (m / moderate-03))))
